bioghist.p: John Bonnell (1893-1992) was a Presbyterian minister who served for 26 years as pastor of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church in New York City, from 1935 to 1962. He was educated at Dalhousie University and Pine Hill Divinity Hall in Nova Scotia. He was ordained in 1922 and served in New Brunswick and Winnipeg, Manitoba, before being invited to Fifth Avenue Presbyterian in New York. Beginning in 1943 Rev. Dr. Bonnell reached three million radio listeners with weekly talks on the ABC network. He was also one of the first religious leaders to provide inspirational messages through a "dial-a-prayer" telephone number.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of transcripts of radio sermons and addresses of John Sutherland Bonnell. Materials include: transcripts of weekly sermons from Bonnell's "School of Religion" and "Bible Study" series, 1936-1943; several sermons from the series "Story Sermons for Boys and Girls"; and transcripts of radio addresses (series include "National Vespers," 1948-1951; "Gems for Thought," 1945-1946; "Our Spiritual Life," 1937-1943; "Radio Chapel," 1946; and several others). The collection also includes a 1980 church bulletin from the ordination service of Richard Sheffield at the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church, New York.
